intro: Conospermum diffusum, commonly known as the spreading conospermum, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a leathery texture, adapted to withstand the dry conditions of its natural habitat. Conospermum diffusum is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
